Case reference: 2016032179.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1944, Richard David was seen for the last time riding his bicycle in front of the family home while his brother was inside the house in Etobicoke, Ontario. Richard's bike was found at the house when his mother returned home that evening but Richard had vanished. He was a good child at home and in school, with no reason to run away.

Socks: Cotton, Grey, Yellow band at top

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2014005752.CaseDesc: On the early morning of March 31, 2007, Candace Shpeley was last seen in Chilliwack, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Ms. Shpeley, a resident of Abbotsford, British Columbia, was travelling from a friend’s residence on the day of her disappearance. Her vehicle, a 1995 green Pontiac Grand Am, was recovered near the Renfrew sky train station in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020069.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1982, a Gimli resident reported that in 1972 Debbie Richardson arrived in Gimli to visit her brother.  According to this report, she stayed with him for approximately three months, then went missing. Debbie's brother last saw her in September, 1972, when he dropped her off on a highway so that she could hitchhike to Winnipeg.  She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005195.CaseDesc: Tommy Charpentier worked on a farm and lived with his employer in Sainte-Brigitte-des-Saults. On the night of December 15, 2008, tracks in the snow indicate that he may have walked on the Nicolet River that passes in front of the farm. Mr. Charpentier’s clothes were found on the frozen surface of the river, near an opening in the ice. This suggests that Mr. Charpentier may have jumped into the icy waters of the Nicolet River.

Scar: Ears, Right ear piercing without earring.
Chest, Left nipple piercing without a ring

Case reference: 2014001164.CaseDesc: On June 29, 2005, a man was found in the St. Lawrence River at 333 of the Commune (near the Old Port Clock). The man had a Egyptian cross pendant that he wore at his waist.

Jewelry: Metal, pendant of an Egyptian cross

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2014003848.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1964, the Grand Rapids RCMP was advised that there were rumors that Harvey Hudson was two weeks over due in returning from a trip to Cedar Lake from Grand Rapids. After numerous inquiries it was discovered M. Hudson left The Pas Manitoba on October 20th and arrived at Cedar Lake Post.  When he reached Cedar Lake, M. Hudson was advised by a friend to wait for a boat from Easterville which was expected shortly. A witness who spoke to M. Hudson indicated that he first left on foot for Easterville but turned back. He then took a canoe and started off for Easterville using a piece of board as a paddle. It is believed that Mr. Hudson had little or no food, no rifle or other camping gear. Numerous land, air and water patrols were made with negative results.

Case reference: 2012020103.CaseDesc: Police are trying to identify a body retrieved from the sea just off the coast of l'Ile Miscou in New Brunswick by crab fishermen on May 3, 1980. The male was caucasian, with a muscular athletic build. His nose had been broken prior to his death. He also had a bridge with 6 gold and porcelain teeth in the top left side of his mouth and regular fillings in the bottom jaw.

Case reference: 2014002831.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1980, Zulfiqar Charania was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Zulfiqar lived in Ottawa but was at his sister’s home in Montreal to spend the holidays. When Zulfiqar left Montreal he did so without his suitcase, which was filled with his personal belongings. Zulfiqar had indicated that he intended on travelling to New York in the United States to visit another family member.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016061073.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1980, the remains of a male was recovered from the Niagara River Whirlpool. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'9"; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he has been in the water for possibly 2 weeks.

Teeth: Has good teeth with several amalgam fillings of the molars.

Case reference: 2021053487.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1988, the partial remains of an unidentified man were discovered on Trespassy beach in Newfoundland and Labrador. The man may have been of Caucasian ancestry.

Case reference: 2012020171.CaseDesc: An adult male was found in a forested area of the Scuzzy Log Dump near North Bend. This is on the west side of the Fraser River, across from Boston Bar.

Teeth: Good dental care with some fillings

Case reference: 2014003051.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1991, Yannick Fortin, age 6, was last seen playing by himself in the backyard of the family residence in Matawin. The backyard of the house overlooks the St. Maurice River. Searches were conducted in the area but Yannick was never seen again.

Case reference: 2012020092.CaseDesc: Edward Keith Geddes was last seen sometime mid April, 2011, in the community of Neilburg, Saskatchewan. Mr. Geddes has been known to travel between Manitoba and British Columbia, and has been employed in the auto repair industry. Mr. Geddes does not have a vehicle associated to him as he was known to buy and sell vehicles on a regular basis.

Case reference: 2011002999.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Pringle is a 61 year old male who was last seen on August 28th, 2010. Mr. Pringle takes medication and when he is not on his medication he becomes agitated and aggressive and makes poor decisions. Mr. Pringle last had his medication on August 27th. All family and friends have been interviewed and no one has seen or heard from Mr. Pringle. Last Seen: walking on Great Northern Road by Second Line East on August 28th, 2010 at 2 pm.  At the time Mr. Pringle was not carrying anything with him and was alone.

Case reference: 2014004923.CaseDesc: On July 24th, 1973, Robert Chaple was reported missing. He was last seen arriving home on July 11th in the early morning hours.

Case reference: 2020017934.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Lebohang Nicol was seen for the last time in the area of 600 University Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Lebohang is also known to go by the first name of “Toby.” He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021030112.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2021, Jeanette Marcotte was reported missing in Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette was last seen in Saskatchewan in 1981 or 1982, where she stated that she was headed to Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017041321.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2017, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Dennis Tuyshime was seen for the last time in Québec City, Québec.

Case reference: 2014002462.CaseDesc: Michel Blanchette resided in north-Montreal and was seen for the last time on October 6, 1972. Late that evening, he went to "Taverne Duvernay" located on "Boulevard de la Concorde" in Laval where he went missing and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006022899.CaseDesc: Eric  Schoenleber was last seen while fishing in a canoe on Innes Lake on May 16, 1972.

Case reference: 2019010720.CaseDesc: Patrick Comeau was last seen on November 13, 2017, in Montreal, Quebec. Patrick has been known to frequent the downtown Montreal area.

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020035043.CaseDesc: On August 17, 2020, Jacques Hébert was seen for the last time when he was preparing to go pick blueberries in the forest near his home in Berry, Quebec. Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Upper denture and lower jaw prothesis with implants fixed to metal bar
Shoes: Rubber, Black, CROCS style, top cut, camouflage pattern, size 9
Pants: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand, work pants
Shirt: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand work shirt

Case reference: 2013000132.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2008 Trevor Warkentin left the Pyschiatric Ward at the MSA Hospital in Abbotsford BC. A hospital staff worker believes seeing Trevor get into a red pick up truck, but no license plate was obtained.

Teeth: Good, Large gap between front teeth

Case reference: 2006002999.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was located in a laneway behind 1556 Bloor Street West near Dundas Street in Toronto on March 21, 1997. He was thought to be a homeless person who frequented the area on a daily basis. Although he appears to be somewhat older, there are no arthritic changes to his bones, which are typical of older individuals. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Grey, White, Wavy, Medium length hair with a grey moustache and beard
Teeth: Poor dental hygiene with one restoration
Other: 750 ml bottle of Andres Golden Cream Canadian Sherry
Foreign Object: Right Ankle, plate and metal screws

Case reference: 2014002675.CaseDesc: Richard Monroe was last seen on October 2nd, 2001 by the owners of Serge's Restaurant on Elgin Street in the city of Greater Sudbury. Richard is believed to have suffered from dementia. He spent most of his time in Thessalon, Sault Ste. Marie, Dunn's Valley, Sudbury and British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014003823.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1996, Patricia Ferguson was seen for the last time in the Pointe-aux-Trembles district of Montreal, Quebec. That night, Patricia had slept at a friend's place but had left the apartment, without her young daughter. She left a note saying she was going out for breakfast, and then meeting her sister. Patricia has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020008557.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1984, at approximately 10:00 am, Rodolf Scoulde was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Rodolf was on his way to a nearby store.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Sword and heart with the word "COCO"

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2006024399.CaseDesc: Mark Cornett was last seen at Missinaibi Lake, 1.0 kilometre north of Fairy Point in Missinaibi Township. He was involved in a boating accident on his way back from fishing and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001137.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1974, the body of a middle aged man was found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. His appendix had been removed and he had lost all of his teeth during his life. He is believed to have died about three weeks earlier from an overdose of barbiturates.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Jeans, With wooden buttons
Jacket: Nylon, Navy blue with red lining

Case reference: 2013000037.CaseDesc: On November 29, 2001, Henry Murillo Asprilla was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. On that day, he had a meeting with lawyers, which he attended with his ex-wife. After the meeting he drove his ex-wife home. Henry has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2014003860.CaseDesc: Carl Charles Raun was reported missing on July 28, 1975. Mr. Raun had a fused spine, causing him to wear a brace, as well as a scar from back surgery. There is a possibility that Mr. Raun disappeared as a result of foul play, however this has not been confirmed.

Case reference: 2006000399.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1988, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 132lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Auburn, Bald, Wavy, Balding in front, sideburns and unshaven with several days growth
Teeth: Many amalgam fillings, 1 composite resin restoration. Missing multiple upper and lower posterior teeth prior to death.
Jeans: Blue, "Renée de France" Brand, size 34" waist and 34" inseam
Money: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Canadian coins $2.26, one American dime
Belt: Leather, Brown, Size 34, with gold buckle & "Genuine Olde English Leather" written on the inner portion
Fractured/Broken Bones: Healed fracture, noticeable bump on the middle of his right collarbone.

Case reference: 2014002164.CaseDesc: Michael Strang was last seen November 21, 1990. Strang was a patient at Centracare psychiatric hospital where he reportedly left from a 3rd story window. Strang has not been heard from since.

Tattoo: Winged Heart - not sure which arm

Case reference: 2018042433.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2018, Vesta Rosta was last seen leaving a Children Aid Society home in Brampton, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Vesta may be in the state of Maryland in the United States of America or in Romania with her parents, Pardelian Rosta and Bacrii Rostas.

Shirt: Black, Red, T-shirt, black with red writing

Case reference: 2014047277.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2014, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Abdool Kisson was last seen leaving his ex-girlfriend’s house in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2006020499.CaseDesc: Theodore Piekarz was initially reported missing in 1978. Piekarz was planning a trip to British Columbia. He was seen at the Kirkland Lake Train Station in October 1986. Mr. Piekarz may suffer from mental health issues, including suicidal tendencies.

Mark: Nose, mole on the right side of his nose

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2016061088.CaseDesc:
On April 25, 1982, the remains of a Black female were found in the Detroit River, near Maple Leaf Mills processing plant, in the city of Windsor, Ontario. Her appendix was present.
She is estimated to have been in the water for 2-4 weeks.

Pants: Beige, Red, Checkered pants with an elastic waist band
Jacket: Light Blue, White, Waist length button down jacket with white edging. Burn mark on the right sleeve.
Tattoo: Right Thigh, Mid-thigh, described as a "Bulls Eye", with the word "Lots" or "Lets"
Scar: Left Chest, 42 cm Thoracotomy scar with metal surgical sutures

Case reference: 2015060160.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1970, a male was found floating in the water at the foot of Seguins Boat House in Rockcliffe, Ottawa. He has partially balding, grey hair. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw. He had 1 cent and a pack of matches in his pocket. It is believed that he had been in the water for up to 48 hours prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw.
Watch: Gold, Gold band with expansion; with the inscribed initials "C.I.B."
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 1.5 x 1 cm slightly depressed scar on his left temple

Case reference: 2013000040.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2002, Bruce Forbes was seen for the last time at a Regent Road residence in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Mr. Forbes suffered from a serious health condition, and required medication on a daily basis. It is believed that Mr. Forbes was not in possession of this medication at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001042.CaseDesc: On July 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified woman was found floating in the Atlantic Ocean near Georges Bank in Newfoundland and Labrador. Evidence shows that the woman had a previous caesarean section, as there was a scar on her pelvic area and there were sutures in her uterus. The woman had worn front top incisors with a slight overlap and had a fractured upper front tooth.

Case reference: 2013000134.CaseDesc: Loretta (Lora) Ann Frank was last seen in Yukon Territory between late 1988 and early 1989. She was known to reside in Watson Lake and Whitehorse, Yukon as well as Lower Post, British Columbia. Loretta was reported missing in 1993. Loretta is known to have a history of mental health concerns.

Case reference: 2008003699.CaseDesc: Gary Anderson and his wife Dawn were camping and fishing on Kilburn Lake in Woodland Caribou Provincial Park.  Mr. Anderson went out fishing on the lake alone in his canoe and never returned. A search by land, water and air turned up only a fishing lure and a hat.

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2014002914.CaseDesc: Edward Allan Street was last seen at his rooming house on Columbia St in Kamloops, BC.  At around 8:30 am on March 4, 2000, Edward told his friends that he was quickly dropping by his place of work but would be back in time for a meeting at 10:00 am.  His wallet and ID were left inside his room.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Foot, Broken foot as a child
Amputation: Right Ring Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Right Middle Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle

Case reference: 2013000082.CaseDesc: On April 26, 2011, Michel Petit was reported missing from his residence located in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. All his personal belongings were found in his apartment and his vehicle was parked in front of his home.

Case reference: 2017073521.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2017, an unidentified woman was recovered from Lake Ontario near Humber Bay Shores Park, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts she was of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest
Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014003840.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1986, a male was seen floating in the river. The male initially responded to police calls however shortly after he was observed going under the water. It is presumed he drowned. The identity of the male was unknown to police until Roderick Cook's parents contacted police advising they had not seen their son for some time. It is assumed the man in the river was Roderick based both on the description and the fact that he was seen walking near the river. Police further found footprints that led from the shore to the open water. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is assumed Mr. Cook drowned.

Teeth: Two front upper teeth are false

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester FEHR was last seen on November 27th, 2012 at approximately 5:30 PM in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North, Saskatoon, SK. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving he told numerous family and friends good bye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Ms. Abigosis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. M. Abigosis was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014001255.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1979, Robert Caldicott last spoke with his father on the telephone. Mr. Caldicott failed to attend several appointments in the following days.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2006016899.CaseDesc: Lisa Maas was last seen leaving a party in the Woodford area.

Case reference: 2014004547.CaseDesc: Ervin Moar is transient in nature and is known to frequent the Main Street strip of Winnipeg, MB. Mr. Moar has not been seen or heard from since June 3, 2004.

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Case reference: 2006017799.CaseDesc: Véronique Courchesne was last seen at her residence November 11, 1979. She was depressed due to a recent medical diagnosis. She had withdrawn money from her bank account prior to going missing. On December 31, 1979 she contacted her husband by telephone but has not been heard from since.

Amputation: Right Chest, Mastectomy to the right breast

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval.  Mr. Marabella was at a service station on Highway 440 between Hwys. 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mr. Marabella's car, a grey Acura MDX was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which Mr. Marabella was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal.  Mr. Marabella was known to be involved in organized crime.  He was linked to the Italian Mafia.

Scar: Abdomen, operation on abdomen for weight loss
Deformity: Abdomen, excess skin due to weigh lost

Case reference: 2016065831.CaseDesc: On October 12, 1977, the remains of a male, believed to be an adult, were found in the water off of Coney Island, Lake of the Woods, Kenora. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was fully clothed, however, no description of clothing is available.  It is believed that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Case reference: 2020015197.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Tony Noskey was seen for the last time as he was riding a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle with his friends near the community of Cadotte Lake in Alberta. During the course of this outing, Tony had disappeared into the bush, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000142.CaseDesc: Richard Dryland was known to be homeless in the Grande Prairie, Alberta area. Mr. Dryland lived a transient lifestyle and often travelled to BC. In November 1993, he was released from the Peace River Correctional Centre. His family has not heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Heart and dagger

Case reference: 2006013999.CaseDesc: Walter Glynn was last seen July 23, 1980 walking southbound on Main Street, Kirkland Lake.  Mr. Glynn was heading to the A&P grocery store at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2005005399.CaseDesc: On April 15, 1993, the body of an unidentified man was found on the shore of Lake Ontario, near the intersection of Maplegrove Road and Lakeshore Road in Lincoln.  His post-mortem weight was recorded as being  174lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Amalgam fillings in his lower molars

Case reference: 2014001739.CaseDesc: In March 1994, Joseph Bucar, having been laid off from Cassiar Mines years prior, had placed his furniture and effects in storage, accumulated credit card debt and disappeared from Kelowna BC.

Case reference: 2014003937.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1990, Reynald Fortin was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. He was known to be despondent and to consume alcohol. Reynald left his apartment without his identification or money.

Case reference: 2014004349.CaseDesc: Candace Giebel was last seen on August 1, 2002. She may have left Vancouver with her boyfriend at that time; her whereabouts and destination are unknown. Her family has not heard from her since her disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020116.CaseDesc: On April 1, 1975, Sylvie Ouimet left the Albert-Prevost institution, where she was hospitalized, without any of her personal effects. Her family has not heard from her since.

Scar: Ears, Surgical scar behind the ear

Case reference: 2020011480.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1988, Amerk Barbarian was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Amerk had been seen by his landlord for the last time when his rent was collected.

Case reference: 2017034100.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2017, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Olumide Arigbede was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2016065657.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1982, this male was recovered from Lake Erie near Port Colborne. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160-170 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is not known how long he had been in the water.

Teeth: Missing third molars; he has some silver fillings and 2 crowns
Shirt: Black, Dark Blue, t-shirt; inscription on the front of the shirt read "SAVE ELECTRICITY..DO IT IN THE DARK"
Socks: Tan, White, rust colored trim on the cuff
Boots: Tan, wearing a single work boot, approximately size 10

Case reference: 2014003733.CaseDesc: Gaétan Anglehart was last seen in a brewery with friends on June 2, 1975, in Montreal, Quebec. That night, Gaétan was seen being forced into a Cadillac vehicle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Star on thumb and index finger
Left Shoulder, Dagger and inverted snake head and a name (unknown)

Case reference: 2006024099.CaseDesc: David Jennings was last seen on June 13, 1991. He is presumed to have drowned on Blackstone Lake in Archipelago Township.

Jacket: Silk, Blue, across shoulders "Bass Fishing"  picture bass fish

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2014002978.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1982, a witness saw Louisette ST-ARNEAULT fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières. Her body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2018063244.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2001, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Marilyn Payne was seen for the last time when she left the hostel she was staying at.

Case reference: 2018056500.CaseDesc: On August 2 1997, Ronald Halpern was last seen leaving his residence to go to the Toronto International Airport. Ronald boarded a flight traveling to the Dominican Republic.

Case reference: 2014003446.CaseDesc: Dawn Crey was a resident of the downtown east side of Vancouver; she was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was reported missing on December 11, 2000 after failing to attend a medical appointment. Foul play is suspected in Ms. Crey's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2018020022.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1968, Jacqueline Lefebvre was last seen while she was at the family cottage in Mascouche, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.
